entry.title: Sines of Life 90: Astral Highway
entry.content:
Lots of new music coming out righ now, from the likes of Joseph Ray, Nox Vahn, Durante, Tinlicker, and more. Of special note, the new three track EP from Jordin Post â€“ taking a break from his Juventa alias â€“ is near as flawless as they come. This mix we feature â€˜Blossomâ€™ from that release, and Iâ€™ll be following up with the titular â€˜Azureâ€™ next month as well.

Gracing our ears once more, this monthâ€™s BackTrack is Disco Fries with â€˜Moving Onâ€™. Itâ€™s fun, it fits, and it got me where I needed to go ðŸ˜‰

As always â€“ Turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.

entry.title: Sines of Life 89: Never Really Goodbye

link.title: Sines of Life 89: Never Really Goodbye

entry.content:
Fun and catchy tracks abound this month, with some wonderful motion and progression in the mix. Dezza, GVN, Sunny Lax, The Dualz, Enamour, and many more grace this delightful end-of-May session.

All that is tempered however by the tragic news last month of Pierce Fultonâ€™s passing. Listening back through his work, there are too many good track to count, from the indefatigable positivity of Kuaga and Life in Letters to his more evocative and asyncopated collaboration as Leaving Laurel, his music helped define the latest generation of dance music. So, we end this monthâ€™s mix with a 15-minute Pierce Fulton mini-mix, knowing he will be truly, sorely missed, but that as long as we still have a personâ€™s music, itâ€™s Never Really Goodbye.

Turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.

entry.title: Sines of Life 88: Still Life Reanimated

link.title: Sines of Life 88: Still Life Reanimated

entry.content:
A meandering and eclectic mix this time around, with fresh goodness from Sultan + Shepard, Sunny Lax, and ALPHA 9, plus some rather old school goodness from Ferry Corsten.

More than a few BackTracks being featured this month, as I found myself wandering through that tough mid-tempo range trying to creep back in sight of 120bpm or so. Thanks to that, we revisit tracks from Chet Porter, Ellie Goulding, 3LAU, and the very sci-fi â€˜System Overrideâ€™ by Makeup and Vanity Set.

Enjoy, and turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.

entry.title: Lifesine Presents: 20 Years Of Anjunabeats
entry.content:
When I heard that fans were invited to vie for a spot alongside 20 Anjunabeats legends in celebrating the 20th Anniversary of the label by submitting an all-Anjunabeats mix compilation, my mind immediately began running through the vast list of favorites from over the last two decades that have stuck with me to this day.

From big, synthy, melodic adventures by Mat Zo, Arty, Kyau & Albert, and Audien to old crate favorites by Solarity, Mike Shiver, Super8 & Tab, and Boom Jinx, through to the bountiful Above & Beyond originals remixed by the label mainstays like ilan Bluestone, Jason Ross, and the more laidback Luttrell â€“Â the sound and character of Anjunabeats has continued to evolve and develop over the years, and every one of these tracks still sounds just as good strung together today as they did on their first play.

So, to A&B themselves and the entire Anjunabeats team & family, thank you for the incredible trip down memory lane, thank you for the opportunity to share my personal Anjuna experience with you, andâ€“most of allâ€“thank you for the many years of incredible music.

Without further adieu â€“ turn it upâ€¦


Lifesine Â· Lifesine Presents: 20 Years Of Anjunabeats

Tracklist

  1. Above & Beyond & Spencer Brown ft. RBBTS - Long Way From Home
  2. Solarity - Terminal 6 (Extended Mix)
  3. Mat Zo - Superman (Original Mix Edit)
  4. Mike Shiver - Ohh (Original Mix)
  5. Moby - Porcelain (Above And Beyond Remix)
  6. Above & Beyond ft. Zoe Johnston - Peace Of Mind (Arty Remix)
  7. Super8 & Tab - Irufushi (Extended Mix)
  8. Above & Beyond, Kyau & Albert - Anphonic (Original Mix)

entry.title: Sines of Life 87: Revolutions
entry.content:
Mmmmmâ€¦ thatâ€™s just about my first and only descriptor for this monthâ€™s mix, with lots of tasty synths and vocals from the likes of Dezza, Tinlicker, Fatum, Matt Lange, JRJ, MEDUZA, and more. All that goodness is rounded out with several gems new and old from Sultan + Shepard (who Iâ€™m still very much grooving on).

I found our BackTrack this month was kicking around in my head for some reason, so I couldnâ€™t help myself from giving it another formal spin. â€˜Metaphysicalâ€™ from Autograf remains a favorite, with that signature sound quite unlike anyone else.

As always, enjoy, and turn it upâ€¦

entry.title: Sines of Life 86: Love Letters
entry.content:
Lots of goodness this episode, with new music from a diverse slate of artists, including Marcus Santoro, David Guetta, Tep No, Luttrell, and Jai Wolf. These and many more, each track its own luscious little Love Letter.

Tuning into a more obscure BackTrack, I needed a funky litter interlude to get me between to tracks, so weâ€™re revisiting â€˜Futuraâ€™ by Jerry Folk.

Closing out the mix, a nod to two of the greatest Robots to ever grace the stage â€“Â and our world â€“Â with their presence, the Pomplamoose cover of â€˜Something About Usâ€™ is a testament to the versatility of their music. There has always been something about them that weâ€™re sure to miss, so enjoy, and turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.

entry.title: Sines of Life 85: Winterâ€™s Fall
entry.content:
This monthâ€™s mix is guaranteed to have you kicking off the frost and moving your hips right out of the gate. Some exciting tracks from acronym-tastic artists GVN, JRJ, and A.M.R, plus our riveting opener â€“ the irresistable earworm â€˜Moonlightâ€™ from Phantoms feat. Sarah Close.

Our BackTrack this month is Bakermatâ€™s summery â€˜Uitzichtâ€™, which I felt had a cheeky little sample that paired nicely with the earlier inclusion of Rank 1â€™s â€˜LED There Be Lightâ€™ from way back in 2008.

Indeed, thereâ€™s a whole lot of light flooding in from this mix, so open up the blinds, enjoy, and turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.

entry.title: Sines of Life 84: Animus
entry.content:
As promised, the spiritual sibling to last weekâ€™s release has arrived! Donâ€™t let the relaxed intro fool you â€“ Animus ramps up quickly and is packed with energetic tracks to animate your week and keep you moving. Listen up for vocally vivacious earworms from Carly Rae Jepsen, Cash Cash, ARTY, Late Night Alumni, and more, plus something funky and retro-reminiscent from Fred Falke, and a cheeky little revamp of ATBâ€™s classic â€˜9pmâ€™.

A repeat from last mix, â€˜Come Backâ€™ by Pretty Pink is our not-so-far BackTrack in this mix â€“ simply too good not to want to spin it again.

Enjoy, and turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.

entry.title: Sines of Life 83: Tesseract
entry.content:
Coming out of 2020 strong with this episode, kicking off with a very catchy track from Faithless and straight into the much anticipated gardenstate remix of Above & Beyondâ€™s â€˜No One On Earthâ€™. That, plus The Midnight, Sultan + Shepard, a feature off of Trance Waxâ€™s debut artist album, and indeed some very warm energy radiating from a pair of PRAANA tracks.

Getting back around to having a BackTrack, we revisit the Croquet Club Remix of Mat Zo and Rachel K Collierâ€™s â€˜Only For Youâ€™, which debuted as the opening track of Sines of Life Episode #02! This one still sounds as good as it did then.

With all that, what else can I say besides enjoy, and turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.

entry.title: Sines of Life 82: Nomad
entry.content:
While the Mellow Mix is typically the last release of the year, I found myself craving something a little more motivating to get up and out for a run during the cold weather. With that impetus to fuel me (and a little extra time on my hands), Nomad was born â€“ a melodic and moving mixtape to keep you energized as we close out 2020.

New singles from Dezza, Luttrell, Icarus, and more, plus some excellent remixes of tracks from Above & Beyond, Armin van Buuren, CHVRCHES, and Farius. It may not need saying at this point but after all, â€˜tis the season for tradition:

Enjoy, and turn it upâ€¦


Download this mix.
